ownable.ownings
Class Painting

java.lang.Object
  ownable.ownings.Ownable
      ownable.ownings.Painting

public class Painting
extends Ownable

A class of paintings as a special kind of ownable. In addition to a value and an owner, paintings have a title and a painter.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Eric Steegmans

Constructor Summary
Painting(Person owner, java.math.BigInteger value, java.lang.String title, Person painter)
          Initialize this new painting with given owner, given value, given title and given painter.
Painting(java.lang.String title)
          Initialize this new painting with given title, having no owner, a value of 0, and no painter.
 
Method Summary

          Return the painter of this painting.

          Return the title of this painting.
static boolean isValidTitle(java.lang.String title)
          Check whether this painting can have the given title as its title.

          Set the painter of this painting to the given painter.

isValidTitle

public static boolean isValidTitle(java.lang.String title)
Check whether this painting can have the given title as its title.

Parameters:
title - The title to check.
Returns:
True if the given title is effective and not empty; false otherwise. | result == (title != null) && (title.length() > 0)

setTitle

@Raw
public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
Set the title of this painting to the given title.

Parameters:
title - The new title for this painting.

getPainter

@Raw
public Person getPainter()
Return the painter of this painting. A null reference is returned if the painter of this painting is not known.

Set the painter of this painting to the given painter.

Parameters:
painter - The new painter for this painting.
